questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
A company sets up a workflow for expense reports. An employee named Sam submits an expense report totaling USD 7,000 to go through the workflow.
//IMG//

Use the drop-down menus to select the answer choice that answers each question based on the information presented in the graphic.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Dear All, It's not a workflow with a manual decision because it contains automated decisions as well.. And also always pay attention to the amount written. First answer is heavily based on 7000 USD
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamicsax-2012/appuser-itpro/workflow-with-multiple-users-in-a-task

1. The expense report will go through Frank, Sue and Ann for approval.
2. Workflow with a line-item workflow element. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/fin-ops/organization-administration/overview-workflow-system

The workflow ends after Sue approves the expense report. This statement is incorrect because the workflow has one more approval step after Sue's approval. The approval step for Ann is still part of the workflow, even though it is not required for the expense report. The workflow ends after Ann approves or skips the expense report
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/create-use-workflows-finance-operations/
Workflow with multiple users in a task. This type of workflow allows you to create a workflow element that requires multiple users to complete a task or approval before the workflow can continue, such as a consensus or a quorum. This type of workflow does not have a line-item workflow element, which is used in the workflow for expense reports.

comments.content: Complete: When a user completes a task, the document that was submitted for processing is assigned to the next user in the workflow, if there is a next user. "If no additional processing is required, the workflow process ends." https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/create-use-workflows-finance-operations/4-assign-users In this case, Ann's process is not required because she only approves expense over $10,000. Then workflow ends after Sue approves report.

discussion.content: Correct

The first one is Ivan, Kim, and Dean must all complete the manual task.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/fin-ops/organization-administration/overview-workflow-system?context=%2Fdynamics365%2Fcontext%2Fcommerce

comments.content: Sorry, I am wrong. A task can be assigned to multiple people. However, only one person can complete a task.

discussion.content:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamicsax-2012/appuser-itpro/workflow-with-multiple-users-in-a-task
It's clearly mentioned "A task can be assigned to multiple people." in the above link.
So, the answer to 2nd question, "Workflow with multiple users in a task" is correct.
If Ivan Kim and Dean need to review the receipts why is this not correct?
so many user involved frank,sue etc, I think its correct

comments.content: SUM,SUE,IVAN, Frank etc so many users

discussion.content: Correct.
I think Multiple users in a task is correct. Manual decision is not a manual task.
Second question should be a workflow with a manual decition.
Why is the second answer, workflow with a manual decision, not correct in the second question?

choices.D: Set the workflow execution account in the workflow parameters
choices.A: Set the workflow batch job to critical
choices.B: Set the workflow messaging batch job group

discussion.content: D is the correct answer

Selected Answer: D
Correct!

this may prove the case for Answer D:
https://technologyblog.rsmus.com/microsoft/troubleshooting-workflow-d365/

I didn't find this tha path System administration > Setup > System > System service accounts in D365.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamicsax-2012/appuser-itpro/specify-the-workflow-execution-account 
do you have any clarification for me?

comments.content: It's under System administration > Workflow > Workflow infrastructure configuration

discussion.content: Technically D

I think A. "The workflow system uses various batch jobs. Workflow message processing is an important batch job used to process workflow messages. If workflow is a key component of your organization, you should consider configuring the Workflow message processing batch job as critical"

Please kindly correct if I am wrong

comments.content: But among the options mentioned in question, Option A will not move workflow from waiting state to any next level. only option which has some impact is option D.

Precisely. Changing the batch job status won't relfect the execution of the job - if it wasn't working, it will still not be working. Either there's some X+ error in the workflow (there's no such response to pick), or.. the workflow account is not set up:-) Thus - D.

Technically D isn't correct either - the "Workflow parameters" link isn't where you specify the execution account, it's "Workflow infrastructure configuration", but the others are definitely wrong so, where as D is only semantically wrong.

questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 Finance system administrator. You have production and testing environments. You move the workflow from the testing environment to the production environment.
The workflow in the production environment is stuck in a wait state.
You need to resolve the issue with the workflow in the production environment.
What should you do?

A company implements Dynamics 365 for Finance.
They need additional information and want a subledger to record information for additional reporting rather than customizing all reports.
You need to set up the posting to accommodate the need for a subledger.
Which three actions should you take? Each answer presents part of the solution.

discussion.content: For me BCE
Posting definitions seems to be linked to Posting profiles, which are linked with the subledger functionality. Also, D involves modifying the reports.

Selected Answer: BCE
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/finance/general-ledger/subledger-transfer

BDE
Microsoft Learn indicates that there is an alternative for posting profiles, and this for many transactions: posting definitions
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/finance/general-ledger/pstg-prfles-ovrvw.
For me it is BDE

Selected Answer: BCE
The correct answers are B, C, and E. You need to create posting profiles to post to the identified area as needed for the request, create posting definitions to post to the identified area as needed for the request, and identify an area of the chart of accounts to record to as the subledger. You do not need to update existing reports to prevent data in the identified area from reporting or to add data in the identified area from reporting.

Selected Answer: BCE
To me, A and D means "customizing existing ledgers", so it's BCE.

C is definitely not included in the correct answers. The go to method of posting for subledgers is usually posting profiles. Posting definitions are only done where there are highly complex posting business requirements, for e.g. where encumbrance accounting is needed.

- Chart of accounts to identify where posting needs to occur
- Posting Profiles
- Update reports to include additional reporting information is correct.

Selected Answer: BCE
This should be the right approch.

Selected Answer: ACE
This is what I feel is right
BCE is the correct answer to this one.
Is it BCE or BCD?
so, the answer given is correct
Forget about posting definitions, this is a functionality that applies to year end process but not used very often
I dont think posting definitions work together with financial dimensions.

BCE seems right to me. I'll be touching everything, that's connected to posting setup (posting profiles, posting definitions and everything else). I won't be updating any reports (unless of course they are developed properly, but we can safely assume that in this question)

choices.E: Identify an area of the chart of accounts to record to as the subledger
choices.C: Create posting definitions to post to the identified area as needed for the request
choices.A: Update existing reports to prevent data in the identified area from reporting
choices.D: Update existing reports to add data in the identified area from reporting
choices.B: Create posting profiles to post to the identified area as needed for the request

questions.question_text:
You are a systems administrator at a company that has implemented Dynamics 365 Finance.
New employees are starting at the company.
You need to extend the electronic signatures functionality to them.
Which two actions should you perform? Each answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.A: On the Email parameters page, specify that SSL is required
choices.D: Select the Electronic signature check box
choices.C: In License configuration, enable Maintenance mode

comments.content: Here, License Configuration depicts LCS. It's C & D. Why not B - because we don't need to specify user's email address as it is already specified in "Users" in System Admin Module and if you will go to "User Options" you will find the email to be already specified from "Users". Please ignore grammatical mistakes.
But C says in License configuration enable maintanance mode. You CAN NOT enable maintanance mode in License configuration form.

discussion.content:
I thought B,D too. But this is what I read from the link provided below the question: (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/fin-ops/organization-administration/tasks/set-up-electronic-signatures)
Enable the Electronic signature configuration key
Go to System administration > Setup > License configuration.
In the tree, expand 'Administration'.
Verify that the Electronic signature check box is selected.
If the Electronic signature check box is not selected, you must enable maintenance mode. Maintenance mode can be enabled in this environment by running a maintenance job from Lifecycle Services, or by using the Deployment.Setup tool locally.
So, it looks as though C,D are correct.
I think B, D. The question is about new employees - so the ESignature functionality already On in the system. Moreover - you can't switch Maintenance mode from Licence configuration form

Selected Answer: BD
C: This action allows you to enable or disable the maintenance mode for the system, which prevents users from accessing the system while system updates or configuration changes are being applied. It is not relevant for extending the electronic signatures functionality to the new employees, as it does not affect the user's ability to sign documents electronically.

C - English should be, "In License Configuration, select the ES checkbox
D- English should be :Enable Maitenance Mode from LCS
Bad questions knowledge by Microsoft?
CD correct. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/fin-ops/organization-administration/tasks/set-up-electronic-signatures
C D are the correct answer,

Go to System administration > Setup > License configuration.
In the tree, expand 'Administration'.
Verify that the Electronic signature check box is selected.
If the Electronic signature check box is not selected, you must enable maintenance mode. Maintenance mode can be enabled in this environment by running a maintenance job from Lifecycle Services, or by using the Deployment.Setup tool locally.
Close the page. [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/fin-ops/organization-administration/tasks/set-up-electronic-signatures] so I will go with C and D

I think adding the "New Employee" part in the scenario text adds confusion. There is no mention if the Electronic Signatures have been setup. From what it appears like, there is no special requirement to setup a user specifically, they just need to be System Users, so it seems like it is asking you how to setup Electronic Signature. So I would go with C and D, even though, Yes you can only turn on Maintenance mode on Tier 2 + environment from LCS.
Actually, the Maintenance Mode should be enabled in LCS portal instead.

Answer is A.
As in an import, if information that exists in the source legal entity doesn't exist in the destination legal entity, the copy process adds it. If information already exists in the destination legal entity, the copy process updates it.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/copy-configuration
Records already existing will be updated with the source data. Answer A

comments.content:
You mean C ?
The source data will not be updated, but the destination data will be deleted (because of duplicates)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/copy-configuration
Correct answer is D.

comments.content: Same data among different legal entities will not be considered duplicate since there is a 'DataAreaId' field in table

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer is C.
Answer A reads "Any source ... data .... will be updated.". I've dotted out the all the contingency wording ("that exists" etc.) to make it clear that what will be updated in that sentence is the source data, not the destination data.

Selected Answer: A
As in an import, if information that exists in the source legal entity doesn't exist in the destination legal entity, the copy process adds it. If information already exists in the destination legal entity, the copy process updates it.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/copy-configuration

Selected Answer: A
Records already existing will be updated with new data (technically overridden)
I have done so many DIXF, it is A for sure
D is correct because the data that is already in the new entity is unique. Nobody said that the data that exists there matches the source data. You can not update data that is not unique.

Selected Answer: A
I tried it in the system it is 100% A.

Selected Answer: A
Correct Answer is A.

If information already exists in the destination legal entity, the copy process updates it.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/copy-configuration
Correct answer is A.

Selected Answer: A
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/copy-configuration
it's definitely D, because in the settings u say remove duplicates.

Selected Answer: A
The Data management workspace is also your hub for copying configuration information from one legal entity to another. The process resembles an export and import that occur in one step. As in an import, if information that exists in the source legal entity doesn't exist in the destination legal entity, the copy process adds it. If information already exists in the destination legal entity, the copy process updates it.
I think answer is A and the data import/export framework settings have nothing to do with the Copy to legal entity function, it's just there to confuse you.
The answer is A, the values in destination LE were replaced from the source LE.
It can't be C as we do not delete "any" data in destination locarion
Answer should be A
Answer C: As duplicates won't be allowed & any data overlapping would be ignored in the source file (import file) & not removed from the destination location.

From the document 99R shared “ If you load a template, and the project already includes an entity that matches an entity in the template, the entity in the project will be replaced by the entity in the template. Some templates are very large, and they might take a few seconds to be loaded.”

comments.content: Actually this quote is more relevant “ As in an import, if information that exists in the source legal entity doesn't exist in the destination legal entity, the copy process adds it. If information already exists in the destination legal entity, the copy process updates it.”

discussion.content: Does anyone know what does 'Remove duplicate' setting do. I think answer lies in this setup.
The existing data is unique to the new legal entity so they should be ignored when the source data is migrated
I would go for A as well. Doesn't it simply overwrite the existing data?

questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 Finance system administrator.
A company named Contoso Ltd. is creating a new legal entity that will be similar to an existing legal entity. Team members copy key entities to the new legal entity using the Data management workspace. They indicate that there were already-configured pieces of data unique to the new legal entity before they ran the Copy into legal entity process.
The data import/export framework settings are listed in the table below:
//IMG//

You need to determine what happened to the already-configured pieces of data. What happened to the data?

choices.C: Any destination legal entity data will be deleted, and the source data will be inserted.
choices.A: Any source legal entity data that already exists in the destination legal entity will be updated.
choices.D: Any source legal entity data that already exists in the destination legal entity will be ignored.
choices.B: Any source legal entity data that already exists in the destination legal entity will be displayed as an error for user action in the Data management workspace.
